document.docTitle: Barsine pluma Cerny, in Cerny & Pinratana 2009
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Barsine zebrina species-complex, with description of three new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Barsine zebrina species-complex, with description of three new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Barsine pluma Černý, in Černy & Pinratana, 2009
,
Moths of Thailand
6 : 73–74, pl. 16, fig. 146, pl. Genitalia 1, figs. T146f, T146v ( Type locality: “W. Thailand , 400 m , Uthai Thani Prov., Khao Nang Rum”).

.

( Fig. 13 ): ♀ , "W. Thailand :
400 m
, Uthai Thani Prov., Khao Nang Rum,
17– 18.XI.1985
, M.G. Allen [leg.], BM 1986-74" ( Coll. NHMUK )
.

.

Remarks. 1. In the original description (Černý & Pinratana 2009), the holotype is cited as a male, but in fact it is a female ( Fig. 13 ). 2. The type series of the species included also series of
B. zebrina
and
B. bucseki
sp. nov.
In fact, only specimens from West and North Thailand with interrupted medial line are conspecific to the holotype . Specimens from South Thailand with an interrupted medial line belong to
B. bucseki
sp. nov.
, and specimens from West and North Thailand with entire medial line belong to
B. zebrina
. All three species differ clearly by the genitalia structures.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 10–11 mm in males and 11–12 mm in females.
B. pluma
( Figs. 13–16 ) is similar externally to
B. zebrina
( Figs. 1–5 ) occurring in Thailand sympatrically with it, but can be separated by the not interrupted medial line. The male genitalia of
B. pluma
( Figs. 35, 36 ) differ from those of
B. zebrina
( Figs. 27–30 ) by the much larger medial costal process, weaker distal costal process, narrower basal lobe of sacculus having smoothly curved dorsal margin, and much longer distal saccular process with pointed apex; the female genitalia of
B. pluma
( Fig. 44 ) are very similar to those of
B. zebrina
( Fig. 42 ), but differ by the broader, T-shaped postvaginal plate (whereas in
B. zebrina
the postvaginal plate is narrower and V-shaped), and slightly smaller signum. The genital differences from
B. bucseki
sp. nov.
are listed in the diagnosis of the latter.

Distribution . The species is widespread in Thailand (provinces Uthai Thani , Tak , Kanchanaburi , Lampang , Chiang Mai , Mae Hong Son , Phayao , Nan , Phetchabun , Sakhon Nakhon , Ubon Ratchatani) and Laos (provinces Phongsali , Luang Prabang , Xayaburi, Vientiane , Khammouan ). The record of
B. pluma
for NE India (Kirti & Singh 2016) is erroneous and belongs to
B. zebrina
.
